content:
Who is using multi-site for BackdropCMS? Asking for a friend.
:-)

I've got a friend from the Drupal 7 world that has been looking at Backdrop for a long time. He is getting ready to start moving Drupal 7 sites to Backdrop, but he currently makes pretty extensive use of Multisite and apparently is having some issues figuring it out.
It's good to know that the two of you are both using it. That is a good sign.
I have about 10 Backdrop sites that I manage overall, and they all run off the one copy of Backdrop core in a multisite configuration. Works great for my needs.
(I also have another 10-ish Drupal 7 sites all running off the one copy of D7 core in a multisite configuration too)
Well, my friend will be really happy to hear that.
I use it extensively on both D7 and Backdrop, along with config management, works very well

issues figuring it out?

Any particular reason for that? Lack of docs?

I use it rather extensively as well, and I have been since at least D5. If he's having issues it might be because setting it up is a little different in Backdrop and D8 than in previous versions. You have to set up the sites/sites.php file now, where it wasn't entirely necessary before, and how you configure a site in sites/sites.php is not entirely intuitive or obvious.
